intro: Octotropis travancorica, commonly known as the Travancore octotropis, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky crevices. Its flowers are small and white or pale green, attracting various pollinators like bees and flies. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native region.
